member.name: F:HeroController.textureDoubleBroSevenAvatars
member.summary: Array of avatar textures specifically for the Double Bro Seven character. Supports multiple avatar variations for this unique hero type that can cycle through different appearances.

member.name: M:HeroController.DeserializeForJoin(UnityStream)
member.summary: Deserializes player data received during network join. Unpacks and updates the local arrays for playing status, controller IDs, and PIDs from the received stream data.
member.param: The UnityStream containing serialized player data.

member.name: M:HeroController.OnAfterDeserialize
member.summary: Unity deserialization callback that rebuilds the hero data dictionary from the serialized list. Handles duplicate keys by incrementing enum values to ensure data integrity. Part of the ISerializationCallbackReceiver interface.

member.name: M:HeroController.OnBeforeSerialize
member.summary: Unity serialization callback that converts the internal hero data dictionary to a serializable list format. Part of the ISerializationCallbackReceiver interface implementation for saving game state.

member.name: M:HeroController.PackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Packs the HeroController's network state for synchronization. Includes checkpoint position, bros released status, round timestamps, and checkpoint ID. Overrides base class to add hero-specific state data.
member.param: The UnityStream to pack state into.
member.returns: The stream with packed state data.

member.name: M:HeroController.SerializeForJoin(UnityStream)
member.summary: Serializes essential player data for network join operations. Packs the playing status, controller IDs, and network PIDs into the stream for transmission to joining players.
member.param: The UnityStream to serialize data into.

member.name: M:HeroController.UnpackState(UnityStream)
member.summary: Unpacks network state data to synchronize the HeroController. Restores checkpoint position, bros released status, timestamps, and checkpoint ID from the stream. Ensures proper state synchronization across the network.
member.param: The UnityStream containing packed state data.
member.returns: The stream after unpacking.

member.name: M:HeroController.DebugDraw
member.summary: Comprehensive debug GUI display showing detailed player and game state information. Displays camera positions, player data tables including controllers, PIDs, playing status, hero states, positions, bot brain settings, and following relationships. Includes interactive controls for bot brain configuration during debug sessions.

member.name: M:HeroController.FindRemotePlayerToFollow(Player)
member.summary: Finds a suitable remote player for bot brain following behavior. Prioritizes remote players over local ones, returning the first remote player found or the last local player if no remote players exist. Returns -1 if no suitable follow target is found.
member.param: The player looking for someone to follow.
member.returns: The player index to follow or -1 if none found.

member.name: M:HeroController.SetTestInfo(HeroType)
member.summary: Sets which hero type should always be chosen for testing purposes. Overrides normal hero selection to force a specific character for debugging and testing.
member.param: The HeroType to always select during testing.

member.name: M:HeroController.UpdateDebugInputs
member.summary: Processes debug keyboard inputs for development and testing. Handles force invulnerability (F8), force level finish (Ctrl+Shift+F9), HUD toggle (Ctrl+F12), and editor-only commands like speed boost and unlock clearing.

member.name: F:HeroController.alwaysChooseHero
member.summary: Forces all players to spawn as a specific hero type when set. Used for testing specific heroes or creating themed gameplay experiences. Set to HeroType.None for normal random/sequential hero selection.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroDefinition.avatar
member.summary: Avatar material for the hero in the HeroDefinition. Used for HUD display to show the hero's face/portrait. Each hero has a unique avatar material for visual identification.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroDefinition.characterReference
member.summary: Reference to the hero character prefab in the HeroDefinition. Points to the TestVanDammeAnim asset that will be instantiated when this hero type is spawned.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroDefinition.name
member.summary: Display name of the hero in the HeroDefinition data structure. Used for UI display, announcements, and hero selection screens. Part of the hero configuration system.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroSetupKeyPair.data
member.summary: The HeroDefinition data in the key-value pair structure. Contains the actual hero configuration including name, prefab reference, and avatar material for the associated HeroType.

member.name: F:HeroController.HeroSetupKeyPair.enumName
member.summary: The HeroType enum value in the key-value pair structure. Maps the enum to its corresponding HeroDefinition data for serialization and configuration management.

member.name: M:Projectile.Awake
member.summary: Initializes layer masks, barrier layers, and projectile configuration during Unity's Awake phase. Sets up collision layers for ground, fragile objects, and team-specific barriers, initializes z-offset from transform position, and establishes random seed for deterministic effects.

member.name: M:Projectile.Start
member.summary: Initializes damage background counter with a random offset between 0 and 0.2 seconds. This creates variation in when projectiles start damaging background elements.

member.name: M:Projectile.Update
member.summary: Main update loop that drives projectile behavior. Calls RunProjectile and RunLife methods each frame with the current delta time to process movement, collision, and lifetime.

member.name: F:Projectile.barrierLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for enemy barrier detection. Set during Awake to include "MobileBarriers" and "IndestructibleGround" layers. Used to detect barriers that can reflect player projectiles, changing their ownership and increasing damage.

member.name: F:Projectile.fragileLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for fragile/destructible object detection. Set to "DirtyHippie" layer during Awake. Used to detect breakable objects like doors and crates that projectiles can damage or destroy on contact.

member.name: F:Projectile.friendlyBarrierLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for player-created barrier detection. Set to "FriendlyBarriers" layer during Awake. Used to detect barriers that can reflect enemy projectiles, converting them to player-owned projectiles with increased damage.

member.name: F:Projectile.groundLayer
member.summary: Layer mask for ground and solid object collision detection. Set during Awake to include "Ground", "LargeObjects", and "FLUI" layers. Used in raycast operations to detect walls and terrain that should stop or reflect projectiles.

member.name: F:Projectile.random
member.summary: Random number generator instance for deterministic projectile variations. Initialized in Awake with either a random seed (0-10000) or the specified seed value. Used to create small random offsets for damage timing and other projectile behaviors that need to be consistent across clients.

member.name: F:Projectile.seed
member.summary: Seed value for deterministic random number generation. Set via the SetSeed method to ensure synchronized projectile behavior across networked games. Used to initialize the random field for consistent randomization of effects and variations.

member.name: F:Projectile.t
member.summary: Delta time value for frame-independent movement calculations. Initialized to 0.011f and updated each frame with clamped Time.deltaTime (maximum 0.0334f). Used throughout the projectile system for consistent movement and timing regardless of framerate.

member.name: F:Projectile.zOffset
member.summary: Z-axis rendering offset for visual depth variation. Randomly set between -0.04 and 0.04 in Awake, or can be overridden during Fire method. Applied to transform position to create slight 3D depth effect and prevent z-fighting when multiple projectiles overlap.

member.name: M:Projectile.Bounce(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: Reverses the projectile's Y velocity to create a bounce effect off surfaces. Sets the Y velocity to its absolute value, ensuring upward movement after bounce. Updates projectile rotation to match new trajectory.
member.param: Information about the surface that was hit

member.name: M:Projectile.Damage(System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Applies damage to this projectile if it's damageable. Reduces projectile damage by the incoming damage amount and destroys the projectile if damage reaches zero. Only processes damage for projectiles marked with isDamageable flag.
member.param: Amount of damage to apply to the projectile
Type of damage being applied
X force component (unused)
Y force component (unused)
Delay before damage is applied (unused)
Player number applying the damage (unused)

member.name: M:Projectile.HitFragile
member.summary: Processes collision with fragile/destructible objects. Uses sphere overlap to detect fragile objects within projectile radius and applies damage to each one found. Called during projectile movement to handle destruction of breakable terrain.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitGrenades
member.summary: Detects and interacts with grenades within projectile radius if canHitGrenades is enabled. Uses Map.KnockAndDamageGrenades to apply knockback force based on projectile velocity. Only processes for projectiles with projectileSize greater than 3.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitHorizontalWalls
member.summary: Specialized collision detection for wide projectiles against horizontal walls. Uses three parallel raycasts (center, up, down) spaced by projectileSize. Only active when horizontalProjectile is set to true.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitOil
member.summary: Checks for oil particles and oily terrain at the projectile's position. Ignites any oil found using EffectsController.IgniteOilParticles within a 24-unit radius. Also ignites oily blocks detected via raycast collision.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitProjectiles
member.summary: Checks for collisions with other projectiles in the vicinity. Uses Map.HitProjectiles to detect and handle projectile-on-projectile interactions within the projectile's radius.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitUnits
member.summary: Detects and damages enemy units within the projectile's area. Uses Map.HitUnits with projectile ownership to find valid targets. Awards deflection achievement if projectile was reflected and kills an enemy. Destroys projectile on successful hit.

member.name: M:Projectile.HitWalls
member.summary: Performs raycast collision detection against walls in the projectile's path. Handles standard wall impacts by applying damage, creating effects, and destroying the projectile. Special handling for depleted uranium perk creates 24-radius explosions on impact. Returns true if wall was hit.
member.returns: True if the projectile hit a wall and was destroyed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.HitWildLife
member.summary: Checks for and damages wildlife units within the projectile's radius. Destroys the projectile with effects if any wildlife is hit. Uses Map.DamageWildLife to apply damage to animals.

member.name: M:Projectile.MakeSparkShower(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates an intense shower of spark particles at the specified position. Generates 12 sparks with randomized velocities based on the provided shower direction. Each spark has high initial velocity (250+ units) for dramatic visual effect.
member.param: X position to create sparks
Y position to create sparks
Base X velocity for spark shower direction
Base Y velocity for spark shower direction

member.name: M:Projectile.ProjectileApplyDamageToBlock(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies damage to terrain blocks with special handling for depleted uranium perks. Creates a 24-radius explosion for player projectiles with depleted uranium, otherwise applies standard block damage. Handles oil ignition for fire damage types.
member.param: The block GameObject to damage
Amount of damage to apply
Type of damage being applied
X component of impact force
Y component of impact force

member.name: M:Projectile.ReflectProjectile(UnityEngine.RaycastHit)
member.summary: Reflects the projectile off barriers with complex angle calculations and damage bonuses. Changes projectile ownership, adds +12 damage, plays reflection sound, and calculates reflection angle based on impact normal and projectile direction. Awards achievement for deflection kills. Returns false if canReflect is disabled.
member.param: Raycast hit information containing impact point and surface normal
member.returns: True if projectile was successfully reflected, false if reflection is disabled

member.name: M:Projectile.RunDamageBackground(System.Single)
member.summary: Periodically damages background doodads along the projectile's path. Uses a timer that triggers every 0.033 seconds, checking and damaging doodads within 3 units of the projectile position. Only processes if affectScenery is enabled.
member.param: Delta time for this frame

member.name: F:Projectile.damage
member.summary: Base damage value for the projectile. Default value is 1. This is the initial damage setting that gets copied to damageInternal during initialization and can be modified by SetDamage method. Represents the projectile's intended damage before any modifiers.

member.name: F:Projectile.damageInternal
member.summary: The actual damage value used in calculations. Initially set from the damage field, but can be modified by fadeDamage mechanics, reflection bonuses (+12), or other gameplay effects. This is the value actually applied when the projectile hits targets.

member.name: F:Projectile.damageType
member.summary: Specifies the type of damage this projectile inflicts (e.g., Bullet, Fire, Explosion). Passed to all damage application methods to determine appropriate hit reactions, visual effects, and special damage behaviors like oil ignition for fire damage.

member.name: F:Projectile.fadeDamage
member.summary: When enabled, causes projectile damage to decrease proportionally with remaining life. Uses the formula damageInternal = fullDamage * (life/fullLife) to create projectiles that weaken over distance. Special interaction with BulletSnakeBroskin weapon type.

member.name: F:Projectile.firedBy
member.summary: Reference to the MonoBehaviour (usually a unit) that created this projectile. Used for damage attribution, preventing self-collision at spawn, and special behaviors like inseminator targeting. Can be modified by return zones and reflection mechanics.

member.name: F:Projectile.fullDamage
member.summary: Stores the original damage value at projectile initialization. Used with fadeDamage mechanic to calculate damage reduction over time using the formula: damage = fullDamage * (life/fullLife). Preserves the initial damage for percentage calculations.

member.name: F:Projectile.playerNum
member.summary: Identifies which player fired this projectile. Value of -1 indicates enemy projectile, 0-3 indicates player 1-4, and 5 indicates a reflected projectile. Used for friendly fire checks, material selection, and damage attribution. Modified during reflection.

member.name: F:Projectile.unitHit
member.summary: Reference to the last unit hit by this projectile. While this field exists in the base Projectile class, it is not actively used and is likely intended for derived classes that need to track specific hit targets.

member.name: M:Projectile.Death
member.summary: Handles projectile destruction with appropriate effects. Creates visual impact effects at the projectile's position, plays death sound if configured, and destroys the GameObject.

member.name: M:Projectile.IncreaseLife(System.Single)
member.summary: Extends the projectile's remaining lifetime by a multiplier. Increases both current life and maximum life values proportionally, allowing projectiles to travel further before expiring.
member.param: Multiplier to apply to the projectile's life (e.g., 2.0 doubles remaining life)

member.name: M:Projectile.MakeEffects(System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates visual effects when the projectile impacts. Generates sparks with physics-based trajectories, optional puff effects, and plays impact sounds. Supports both raycast-based hit information and position-only effects. Only creates effects once unless canMakeEffectsMoreThanOnce is enabled.
member.param: Whether to create particle effects (currently unused)
X position for the effects
Y position for the effects
Whether to use raycast hit information for effect direction
Normal vector of the surface hit (used if useRayCast is true)
Exact point of impact (used if useRayCast is true)

member.name: M:Projectile.MoveProjectile
member.summary: Updates the projectile's position based on current velocity and delta time. Applies doubled movement when doubleSpeed is enabled, effectively moving the projectile twice per frame for increased speed. Handles Z-axis positioning for rendering depth.

member.name: M:Projectile.OnDestroy
member.summary: Cleanup method called when the projectile GameObject is destroyed. Deregisters the projectile from the Map system and calls base class cleanup.

member.name: M:Projectile.PlayDeathSound
member.summary: Plays the projectile's death sound effect if a sound holder is configured. Uses the projectile's position and configured volume, with playback priority of 0.65.

member.name: M:Projectile.RunLife(System.Single)
member.summary: Manages projectile lifetime countdown and destruction. Decrements life by delta time each frame, applying damage fade if enabled. When life reaches zero or damage fades completely, destroys the projectile with appropriate effects.
member.param: Delta time for this frame

member.name: M:Projectile.RunProjectile(System.Single)
member.summary: Core projectile update method that processes movement, collision detection, and damage application. Handles projectile physics, checks for unit/terrain hits, applies damage to background elements, manages return zone interactions, and processes special behaviors like reversing. Updates position based on velocity and delta time.
member.param: Delta time for this frame

member.name: M:Projectile.SetDoubleSpeed
member.summary: Activates double speed mode for the projectile. Limits the projectile's life to a maximum of 1 second and enables the doubleSpeed flag which causes MoveProjectile to update position twice per frame.

member.name: P:Projectile.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the projectile's 2D position. Setting the position updates both the X and Y coordinates and immediately applies the new position to the transform. Getting returns the current X,Y as a Vector2.

member.name: P:Projectile.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the projectile's 2D velocity vector. Setting velocity updates both xI and yI components and recalculates the projectile's rotation to match the new direction. Getting returns xI,yI as a Vector2.

member.name: F:Projectile.affectScenery
member.summary: Controls whether this projectile can damage background scenery and doodads. Default is true. When disabled, the projectile passes through destructible background elements without affecting them. Checked in RunDamageBackground method.

member.name: F:Projectile.canHitGrenades
member.summary: Determines if this projectile can interact with grenades. Default is true. When enabled, the projectile will knock back and potentially damage grenades it encounters. Only applies to projectiles with projectileSize greater than 3.

member.name: F:Projectile.canMakeEffectsMoreThanOnce
member.summary: When enabled, allows MakeEffects to create visual effects multiple times during the projectile's lifetime. Works with hasMadeEffects flag to control whether effects can be repeated for projectiles that hit multiple targets or surfaces.

member.name: F:Projectile.damageBackgroundCounter
member.summary: Timer controlling periodic background damage checks. Initialized with a small random negative value (-0.2 to 0) and increments by delta time. When positive, triggers background damage check every 0.033 seconds if affectScenery is enabled.

member.name: F:Projectile.damagedBackground
member.summary: Flag tracking whether this projectile has already damaged background elements. Prevents multiple damage applications to scenery during a single projectile's lifetime. Set to true after first background damage event.

member.name: F:Projectile.doubleSpeed
member.summary: Speed multiplier flag that doubles projectile movement when enabled. Set via SetDoubleSpeed method which also caps projectile life at 1 second. Applied in MoveProjectile to effectively move the projectile twice per frame.

member.name: F:Projectile.flickPuff
member.summary: Puff effect prefab created when the projectile damages background scenery or doodads. Instantiated by EffectsController.CreateProjectilePuff during background damage checks to provide visual feedback for environmental destruction.

member.name: F:Projectile.fullLife
member.summary: Original lifetime value stored at projectile initialization. Used with fadeDamage to calculate damage reduction over time and preserved for any mechanics that need to reference the projectile's initial lifetime setting.

member.name: F:Projectile.hasHit
member.summary: Flag indicating the projectile has already hit a target. Set to true on successful collision to prevent multiple hit registrations from the same impact. Ensures projectiles only deal damage once per target.

member.name: F:Projectile.hasMadeEffects
member.summary: Tracks whether visual impact effects have been created. Prevents duplicate effect spawning unless canMakeEffectsMoreThanOnce is enabled. Set to true after first effect creation in MakeEffects method.

member.name: F:Projectile.isDamageable
member.summary: Indicates whether this projectile can be damaged and destroyed by attacks. While this field exists in the base class, it is not actively used in the base implementation and is likely intended for derived projectile types that can be shot down.

member.name: F:Projectile.life
member.summary: Remaining lifetime of the projectile in seconds. Default value is 4 seconds. Decreases by delta time each frame and destroys the projectile when it reaches zero. Can be modified by SetDoubleSpeed (caps at 1 second) and IncreaseLife methods.

member.name: F:Projectile.projectileSize
member.summary: Collision radius of the projectile in units. Default value is 8. Used for all sphere-based collision checks, hit detection radii, and raycast distances. Larger values create projectiles that can hit targets more easily and affect wider areas.

member.name: F:Projectile.shrapnel
member.summary: Shrapnel prefab reference for creating debris particles. While not directly used in the base Projectile class, this field is available for derived projectile types to create custom shrapnel effects on impact.

member.name: F:Projectile.shrapnelSpark
member.summary: Spark shrapnel prefab reference for creating spark particles. While not directly used in the base Projectile class, this field is available for derived projectile types to create custom spark effects, particularly for metal impacts.

member.name: F:Projectile.sound
member.summary: Lazy-initialized Sound instance for playing projectile audio effects. Created on demand in PlayDeathSound when the projectile is destroyed. Cached to avoid creating multiple Sound objects for the same projectile.

member.name: F:Projectile.soundHolder
member.summary: Reference to the SoundHolder component containing this projectile's sound effects. Used in PlayDeathSound to play impact sounds when the projectile is destroyed. Configured per projectile type for unique audio feedback.

member.name: F:Projectile.soundVolume
member.summary: Volume level for projectile sound effects. Default value is 0.2f (20% volume). Applied when playing death sounds through the sound holder to control audio levels relative to other game sounds.

member.name: F:Projectile.sparkCount
member.summary: Number of spark particles created on impact. Default value is 10. Used in MakeEffects to determine how many sparks to generate. Different impact contexts use full count or reduced counts for visual variety.

member.name: F:Projectile.startProjectileSpeed
member.summary: Initial speed magnitude of the projectile when fired. Default 400f but set from velocity vector magnitude in Fire method. Used in collision prediction calculations to determine raycast distances based on projectile speed.

member.name: F:Projectile.whitePopEffect
member.summary: Determines the type of impact effect created. When true, creates a white pop effect instead of the standard projectile pop effect. Used in MakeEffects to provide visual variety for different projectile types.

member.name: F:Projectile.z
member.summary: The projectile's Z-axis position used for rendering depth. Updated during movement to maintain proper visual layering with other game objects.

member.name: M:Projectile.Fire(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour)
member.summary: Primary initialization method that launches the projectile. Sets position, velocity, player ownership, and performs comprehensive spawn validation including collision checks, unit hits, and barrier reflections. Applies perk-based scaling for player projectiles and sets appropriate team materials.
member.param: Starting X position of the projectile
Starting Y position of the projectile
Initial X velocity
Initial Y velocity
Z-axis offset for rendering depth
Player number who fired the projectile (0-3 for players, -1 for enemies)
Reference to the unit that fired this projectile

member.name: M:Projectile.GetSuggestedSpeed
member.summary: Returns the suggested default speed for projectiles, used as a baseline for velocity calculations. Standard projectiles return 120 units per second.
member.returns: The suggested projectile speed (120f)

member.name: M:Projectile.SetDamage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the projectile's damage value, updating both the internal damage tracking and the public damage field used for display and calculations.
member.param: The damage value to set

member.name: M:Projectile.SetPosition
member.summary: Updates the projectile's transform position using rounded X and Y coordinates with the configured z-offset for proper rendering depth.

member.name: M:Projectile.SetRotation
member.summary: Calculates and applies rotation to the projectile's transform based on its current velocity. Uses atan2 to determine angle from velocity vector and converts to degrees. Applies an additional 180-degree rotation for horizontal projectiles.

member.name: M:Projectile.SetSeed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the random seed for this projectile, creating a new Randomf instance with the specified seed for deterministic random behavior in effects and variations.
member.param: The seed value for random number generation

member.name: M:Projectile.SetSpeed(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the projectile's velocity vector and recalculates its rotation to match the new direction of travel.
member.param: New X velocity component
New Y velocity component

member.name: F:Projectile.canReflect
member.summary: Controls whether this projectile can be reflected by barriers. Default is true. When disabled, projectile ignores barrier collision checks that would normally cause reflection. Used to create projectiles that pass through or are destroyed by barriers instead of bouncing off.

member.name: F:Projectile.enemyMaterial
member.summary: Material applied to enemy-fired projectiles for visual team identification. Set through CheckFriendlyFireMaterial when playerNum is negative. Creates visual distinction between projectiles that can harm the player versus those that cannot.

member.name: F:Projectile.friendlyMaterial
member.summary: Material applied to player-fired projectiles for visual team identification. Set through CheckFriendlyFireMaterial when playerNum is 0 or greater. Helps players distinguish between friendly and enemy projectiles at a glance.

member.name: F:Projectile.horizontalProjectile
member.summary: Determines raycast behavior for collision detection. Default is true. When true, uses offset raycasts from projectile sides for barrier detection. When false, uses direct center raycasts. Affects how projectiles interact with barriers and walls.

member.name: F:Projectile.isWideProjectile
member.summary: Indicates if this is a wide projectile that requires special collision handling. When true, skips horizontal wall collision checks. Used in conjunction with horizontalProjectile to determine appropriate collision detection methods.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckSpawnPoint
member.summary: Comprehensive spawn point validation that checks for walls, doodads, return zones, barriers, and units at the projectile's starting position. Handles barrier reflections for both enemy and friendly projectiles, destroys projectile if spawning inside solid objects, and attempts to hit units at spawn location. Registers projectile with Map system if spawn is valid.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckSpawnPointFragile
member.summary: Checks for fragile/destructible objects at spawn location using a 5-unit radius sphere overlap. Creates puff effects and applies damage to all fragile objects found, but does not destroy the projectile.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckWallsAtSpawnPoint
member.summary: Checks for wall collisions at the projectile's spawn position using a 5-unit radius sphere overlap. Applies damage to any walls found (excluding the firing unit's collider) and destroys the projectile if walls are hit, creating appropriate impact effects.
member.returns: True if walls were hit and projectile was destroyed, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.TryHitUnitsAtSpawn
member.summary: Attempts to damage units at the projectile's spawn location. Handles special case for inseminator units (alien face huggers) by targeting their host unit with double damage. Destroys projectile with effects if any units are successfully hit.

member.name: F:Projectile.raycastHit
member.summary: Stores the result of raycast collision detection operations. Contains hit point, surface normal, collider reference, and other collision data used for creating effects, calculating reflections, and applying damage at the correct position and angle.

member.name: M:Projectile.AvoidRect(UnityEngine.Transform,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method for implementing projectile avoidance behavior around rectangular areas. Base implementation is empty - derived projectile types override this to steer around obstacles.
member.param: Transform of the rectangle to avoid
Width of the avoidance area
Height of the avoidance area

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckFriendlyFireMaterial
member.summary: Updates the projectile's visual material based on team affiliation. Player projectiles (playerNum >= 0) use the friendly material if available, while enemy projectiles use the enemy material. Helps players identify projectile ownership visually.

member.name: M:Projectile.CheckReturnZones
member.summary: Scans for nearby ProjectileReturnZones that can capture and reverse this projectile. Only captures enemy projectiles (playerNum -1) within 64 units of an active zone. Initiates reversal behavior when a valid zone is found.
member.returns: True if the projectile was captured by a return zone, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.IsHeldByZone
member.summary: Checks if this projectile is currently being held and reversed by a return zone. Returns true when the projectile has an active zone reference and is in reversing state.
member.returns: True if held by a return zone, false otherwise

member.name: M:Projectile.ReverseProjectile
member.summary: Initiates projectile reversal toward its firing unit. Sets reverse velocity targets to 80% of negative initial velocity, creating a boomerang effect. Only reverses if the original firing unit still exists.

member.name: M:Projectile.RunReversing
member.summary: Handles projectile reversal behavior when captured by return zones. Gradually adjusts velocity toward the zone's return point using interpolation. Destroys the projectile when it gets within 16 units of the target position.

member.name: M:Projectile.Target(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Virtual method for implementing projectile targeting behavior. Base implementation is empty - guided projectile types override this to track toward specified coordinates.
member.param: X coordinate of the target position
Y coordinate of the target position
Player number associated with the targeting

member.name: P:Projectile.StopBeingControlled
member.summary: Virtual property that indicates whether the projectile should stop being controlled by external systems. Base implementation always returns false, but can be overridden by guided projectiles to signal when they should stop tracking targets.

member.name: F:Projectile.giveDeflectAchievementOnMookKill
member.summary: When enabled, awards the "bronald_bradman" achievement if this deflected projectile kills an enemy. Checked in HitUnits when the projectile successfully damages a target. Used to track player skill in deflecting enemy projectiles back at enemies.

member.name: F:Projectile.heldDelay
member.summary: Random delay before reversed projectile starts moving. Set to 0-0.333 seconds when caught by a return zone. Decrements each frame in RunReversing, creating a brief pause before the projectile reverses direction.

member.name: F:Projectile.reverseXI
member.summary: Target X velocity for projectile reversal. Set to 80% of negative current X velocity when reversal begins. Used in RunReversing for smooth interpolation from current to reversed trajectory.

member.name: F:Projectile.reverseYI
member.summary: Target Y velocity for projectile reversal. Set to 80% of negative current Y velocity when reversal begins. Used in RunReversing for smooth interpolation from current to reversed trajectory.

member.name: F:Projectile.reversing
member.summary: Indicates the projectile is being reversed by a return zone (like Brondleman's ability). Set to true when captured by a ProjectileReturnZone. Triggers special movement behavior in RunReversing that gradually redirects the projectile.

member.name: F:Projectile.zone
member.summary: Reference to the ProjectileReturnZone currently controlling this projectile. Set when the projectile enters a return zone's area of effect. Used to determine if the projectile should continue reversing behavior or has escaped the zone's influence.

member.name: M:Projectile.DeregisterProjectile
member.summary: Removes this projectile from the Map's projectile tracking system, typically called during cleanup when the projectile is destroyed.

member.name: M:Projectile.RegisterProjectile
member.summary: Registers this projectile with the Map's projectile tracking system, allowing it to be found by other game systems for collision detection and effects.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.Awake
member.summary: Unity's Awake method that initializes mathematical lookup tables when the ProjectileController is first created.

member.name: P:ProjectileController.instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of ProjectileController. Uses lazy initialization to find or create the instance when first accessed.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.inst
member.summary: Private static field that stores the singleton instance of ProjectileController.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.SpawnGrenadeLocally(Grenade,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Spawns a grenade locally without network synchronization. Sets up the grenade with physics parameters and launches it.

The MonoBehaviour that threw this grenade.
The X position to spawn the grenade.
The Y position to spawn the grenade.
The explosion radius of the grenade (passed to SetupGrenade but actual usage depends on grenade type).
The explosion force of the grenade (passed to SetupGrenade but actual usage depends on grenade type).
The initial X velocity of the grenade.
The initial Y velocity of the grenade.
The player number who owns this grenade.
Random seed for deterministic grenade behavior.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.returnZones

member.name: M:ProjectileController.GetAirstrikeGrenadePrefab
member.summary: Gets the airstrike grenade prefab used for calling in aerial bombardments.
member.returns: The airstrike Grenade prefab.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.GetAlienPheromoneGrenadePrefab
member.summary: Gets the alien pheromone grenade prefab used for alien-related mechanics.
member.returns: The alien pheromone Grenade prefab.

member.name: M:ProjectileController.GetMechDropGrenadePrefab
member.summary: Gets the mech drop grenade prefab used for deploying mechs.
member.returns: The mech drop Grenade prefab.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.airstrikeGrenade
member.summary: The grenade prefab for airstrike special abilities. Used by character abilities and perks to call in aerial bombardment at marked locations. Can be spawned with stance-based trajectories (close-range: 30 velocity/70 angle, long-range: 200 velocity/150 angle) or immediately detonated for instant strikes. Shared with SpecialAbilitiesController for consistent access.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.alienPheromoneGrenade
member.summary: The grenade prefab for alien pheromone biological warfare. Creates pheromone effects that influence alien enemy behavior when detonated. Available as pocketed special ammunition pickup. Uses stance-based throwing system (crouching: 30/70 for close range, standing: 200/150 for long range) and shares animation behavior with airstrike and mech drop abilities.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.allGrenadePrefabs
member.summary: Unity Inspector field containing references to all grenade prefabs in the game. Not referenced in code but likely populated via Unity Editor for cataloging, validation, or potential editor tooling purposes. Serves as a central registry of available grenade types.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.allProjectilePrefabs
member.summary: Unity Inspector field containing references to all projectile prefabs in the game. Not referenced in code but likely populated via Unity Editor for cataloging, validation, or potential editor tooling purposes. Initialized as empty list in code.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.assasinationTargetPrefab
member.summary: The assassination target prefab used by Matilda for marking elimination targets.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.broGummerSniperTargetPrefab
member.summary: The specialized sniper targeting system prefab used by Bro Gummer.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.brobocop
member.summary: The projectile prefab specifically used by Brobocop character.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.fireBallBombardment
member.summary: The projectile prefab used for fireball bombardment attacks. Used in TimePressureBombardment for Rogueforce procedural generation mode to create environmental fire hazards. Spawned at random positions and immediately detonated to create explosive fiery bombardment effects.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.goldenLightProjectile
member.summary: The golden light projectile prefab, likely used for special holy or light-based attacks by specific characters or abilities.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.mechDropGrenade
member.summary: The grenade prefab for mech deployment special ability. Acts as a beacon that spawns a combat mech on detonation. Part of the pocketed special ammo system - players can collect and use this to deploy mechs using stance-based throwing mechanics identical to airstrikes. Uses custom animation sequence (row 5, frames 17-24) with deployment trigger at frame 4.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.remoteRocketPrefab
member.summary: The prefab for remote-controlled rockets that can be guided by the player.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.shellBombardment
member.summary: The projectile prefab used for artillery shell bombardment attacks.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.targetPrefab
member.summary: A general-purpose following object prefab that can track targets.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.targetSystemPrefab
member.summary: The targeting system prefab used by Robocop for locking onto enemies.

member.name: F:ProjectileController.teleportTargetPrefab
member.summary: The remote teleport target prefab used for marking teleportation destinations in teleportation-based abilities and mechanics.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AddBoxCollider
member.summary: Adds or configures a BoxCollider component with character-specific collision dimensions. Sets different box sizes and centers for various enemy types (Xenomorph, FaceHugger, etc.) with default humanoid dimensions as fallback.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AddRigidbody
member.summary: Adds or configures a Rigidbody component for physics simulation. Sets the rigidbody to kinematic mode with gravity disabled for manual physics control.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Awake
member.summary: Unity lifecycle method that initializes TestVanDammeAnim. Sets up sprite systems, parachute functionality, collision layers, materials, and core physics components required for character operation.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FixedUpdate
member.summary: Unity fixed update method that runs oil test checking at fixed intervals.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.LateUpdate
member.summary: Unity lifecycle method for post-frame updates. Handles input bit preservation, inseminator unit synchronization, map disable area extension, and quicksand checking.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.OnDestroy
member.summary: Unity lifecycle callback when the GameObject is destroyed. Calls base implementation for cleanup.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.OnDisable
member.summary: Unity lifecycle callback when the component is disabled. Empty implementation for potential override.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.OnEnable
member.summary: Unity lifecycle callback when the component is enabled. Empty implementation for potential override.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RegisterUnit
member.summary: Registers this unit with the Map system for game tracking and management.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunSync
member.summary: Network synchronization method that updates the unit's position. Calls base synchronization and updates position based on current transform.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetDefaultGroundLayer
member.summary: Sets up the default ground collision layer mask including Ground, LargeObjects, and IndestructibleGround layers for ground detection and collision checking.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetDeltaTime
member.summary: Updates the frame delta time with clamping to prevent large time steps. Stores previous frame time and clamps current time to maximum of 0.0334 seconds.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetHighFiveBoostDeltaTime
member.summary: Sets modified delta time during high-five boost effects. Applies different time multipliers based on time scale and special boost conditions.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetStrictGroundLayer
member.summary: Sets up a strict ground collision layer mask including only Ground and IndestructibleGround layers, excluding LargeObjects for more restrictive ground detection.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Start
member.summary: Unity lifecycle method that handles game mode-specific initialization. Configures special ammo based on game mode (deathmatch, procedural generation, campaign), sets up sound system, avatar states, and initial invulnerability.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Update
member.summary: Core Unity lifecycle method that executes the main update loop for TestVanDammeAnim each frame. Processes essential character systems in this execution order: 1. **Acid coverage effects** - Visual and damage processing for acid-covered characters 2. **Delta time management** - Frame timing with high-five boost support 3. **Input processing** - Handle player input or trigger action control 4. **Status effect timers** - Stun, freeze, zombie revival, and death counters 5. **Animation frame management** - Sprite frame advancement and timing 6. **Movement calculation and execution** - Core physics and movement processing 7. **Special movement states** - Impaled, strung-up, or platform movement 8. **Combat systems** - Weapon management, firing, and melee processing 9. **Hero-specific systems** - Checkpoints, rescues, enemy alerting, item pickup 10. **Invulnerability management** - Temporary invincibility and revival timing 11. **Alien infection system** - Insemination mechanics and chest-bursting 12. **Environmental effects** - Ducking, grass interaction, boundary checks 13. **Audio and visual effects** - Wall dragging sounds, trails, freeze shaders 14. **Player management** - Kick system and recall mechanics 15. **Parachute system** - Deployment timing and physics modification This method coordinates all core character functionality and represents the main execution loop for character behavior.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CancelMelee
member.summary: Cleanly exits melee state and resets all melee-related variables. Clears all melee flags, removes target reference, and intelligently determines next action state based on current conditions (preserves ladder climbing, sets jumping if airborne, running if moving, or idle).

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CheckBustCage
member.summary: Checks if there's a cage in front of the player that can be broken. Performs a raycast within 16 units to detect cage components.
member.returns: True if a cage is found that can be busted, false otherwise

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CheckPlasmaDeath(System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Handles special plasma/vaporization death effects when plasma damage is 1 or greater. Creates white flash effects and for explosion damage types, generates area damage and smoke effects while shaking the camera and disturbing nearby wildlife. Returns true if plasma death occurred.
member.param: Reference to horizontal gib velocity, modified for plasma deaths
Reference to vertical gib velocity, modified for plasma deaths
member.returns: True if plasma death effects were triggered, false otherwise

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CreateGibEffects(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates appropriate visual effects when the character is gibbed based on damage type. Crush damage creates a spread pattern, OutOfBounds uses larger spread, and BittenBySandworm creates directional effects. Generates frozen particles if the character was frozen, plays gib sounds, and sprays blood effects.
member.param: Type of damage determining the gib effect pattern
Base horizontal velocity for effects
Base vertical velocity for effects

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CreateGibs(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Default gib creation method that generates standard gib pieces with velocity. Uses the character's material for gib textures and applies an upward bias to gib velocity for more dramatic effect.
member.param: Horizontal velocity for gib pieces
Vertical velocity for gib pieces

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Damage(System.Int32,DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Core damage handling method that processes all incoming damage to the character. Handles special cases like inseminator unit redirection, parachute destruction (grants 1.33s invulnerability), instant-gib damage types, acid coverage, skeleton creation, and damage reduction based on game mode. Creates appropriate visual effects (blood, impact effects) and manages death state including revival mechanics. Triggers death sequence if health drops below zero.
member.param: Amount of damage to apply
Type of damage being applied (affects reactions and effects)
Horizontal impulse force from damage
Vertical impulse force from damage
Direction of incoming damage (-1 left, 1 right)
The MonoBehaviour that caused the damage (for kill tracking)
X coordinate where damage was applied
Y coordinate where damage was applied

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.DealWithBounce(DamageType@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Handles bounce damage differently based on whether the unit is a player or enemy. For players in non-competitive modes, nullifies all damage and applies a 0.25 second blind effect instead. For enemies or players in DeathMatch/BroDown modes, changes the damage type to Crush.
member.param: Reference to the damage type, may be changed to Crush
Reference to the damage amount, set to 0 for players in non-competitive modes

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Death(System.Single,System.Single,DamageObject)
member.summary: Handles the complete character death sequence. Cancels active melee attacks, deactivates parachute, stops network syncing, clears revival sources, stops player UI bubbles, reports kills for scoring, reduces lives if applicable, applies death velocity modifications, deactivates weapons, creates blood effects, releases held objects, disables collision, and saves death GIFs for player characters. This is the main death orchestration method.
member.param: Horizontal velocity to apply on death
Vertical velocity to apply on death
DamageObject containing information about what killed the character

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.DestroyRemoteProjectile
member.summary: Destroys a remotely controlled projectile. Clears controlling flag and calls Death() on the projectile.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FallDamage(System.Single)
member.summary: Virtual method for handling fall damage based on fall velocity. Empty implementation for subclasses to calculate and apply fall damage.
member.param: The vertical velocity at impact

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FindNearbyMook
member.summary: Searches for a nearby mook that can be interacted with. Prioritizes skinned mook on the player's back, otherwise searches for mooks within 30 unit radius behind the player.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.FireWeapon(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Fires weapon projectile at specified position and velocity. Sets gun animation frame, creates muzzle flash, spawns projectile, and triggers fire events.
member.param: X position for projectile spawn
Y position for projectile spawn
X velocity for projectile
Y velocity for projectile

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Gib(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Destroys the character into gibs (gore pieces) if gibbing is allowed. Releases held objects, sets appropriate death type, creates gib visual effects, sends network RPC to synchronize gibbing, saves death GIFs for heroes, handles special plasma death effects, and disconnects any attached face huggers.
member.param: Type of damage that caused the gibbing
Horizontal velocity for gib pieces
Vertical velocity for gib pieces

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.GibRPC(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Network RPC handler for synchronizing gibbing across all connected players. Updates the character position for out-of-bounds deaths and calls the local Gib method to ensure consistent visual effects across the network.
member.param: Type of damage that caused the gibbing
Horizontal velocity for gib pieces
Vertical velocity for gib pieces
X position for out-of-bounds gibbing
Y position for out-of-bounds gibbing

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.IsLockedInMelee
member.summary: Checks if character is locked in melee animation. Used to prevent other actions during melee attacks.
member.returns: True if doing melee and cannot do independent animations, false otherwise

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Knock(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies knockback force to the character from damage or explosions. Clears any impalement state and ignores knockback if frozen. Applies half the horizontal knockback force and uses different vertical limits for heroes (300) versus enemies (400). Automatically deactivates parachute if knocked upward.
member.param: Type of damage causing the knockback
Horizontal knockback force (half is applied)
Vertical knockback force
Whether to force the character into a tumbling state (currently unused)

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.KnockSimple(DamageObject)
member.summary: Simplified knockback method using a DamageObject for consistent force application. Ignores knockback if frozen and applies blast forces with the same velocity clamping as SetVelocity method.
member.param: DamageObject containing knockback force information

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ReleaseAlien(Mook,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: RPC method that handles alien release from chest bursting. Applies fire damage to spawned alien if specified.
member.param: The alien unit being released
X velocity for alien spawn
Y velocity for alien spawn
Whether the alien should be set on fire
Index of player that witnessed the spawn

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ReleaseGrenadeRPC(Grenade,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: RPC method for releasing grenades across network. Handles grenade physics and positioning.
member.param: Grenade object to release
X velocity for grenade
Y velocity for grenade
X position for grenade release
Y position for grenade release

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ReleaseHeldObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases currently held object (grenade or mook) with appropriate physics and networking. Handles both throwing and dropping scenarios.
member.param: Whether object is being thrown (true) or dropped (false)

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunFiring
member.summary: Main firing logic update that manages fire rate, delays, and weapon usage. Stops rolling when firing, handles fire counter and rate modifications, triggers the UseFire method, applies avatar effects, and clears gesture animations during combat.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunIndependentMeleeFrames
member.summary: Virtual method for handling melee animation frames independently from main animation. Allows subclasses to implement custom melee animation logic.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunKnifeMeleeMovement
member.summary: Handles movement physics during knife melee attacks with three distinct patterns. Old system applies simple gravity. Jumping melee applies falling gravity with speed clamping. Dashing melee uses frame-based movement: frames 0-1 stop movement, frames 2-3 dash horizontally (with target tracking if available), frames 4-5 reduce speed, frames 6+ apply only gravity. Quicksand disables horizontal movement.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunMelee
member.summary: Executes melee attack behavior by delegating to RunKnifeMeleeMovement. Acts as the entry point for melee execution.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetMeleeType
member.summary: Determines the type of melee attack (standing, jumping, or dashing) based on current character state. When using new knifing frames, checks if jumping, moving horizontally, or on ladder to set appropriate melee type.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetVelocity(DamageType,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets character velocity from damage or explosion forces, adding to existing velocity rather than replacing it. Clamps horizontal velocity to 200 and vertical velocity between -20000 and 300 to prevent excessive speeds.
member.param: Type of damage causing the velocity change
Horizontal velocity to add
Additional horizontal blast force (currently same as xI)
Vertical blast force to add

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetupThrownMookVelocity(System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates output velocity for thrown mook objects. Sets X velocity to 210 units in facing direction plus 20% of current momentum, and Y velocity to 120 units upward plus 30% of current vertical momentum.
member.param: Output X velocity for thrown mook
Output Y velocity for thrown mook

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SpawnPrimaryProjectile(Projectile,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Spawns primary weapon projectile using the ProjectileController system with specified parameters.

X position for projectile spawn
Y position for projectile spawn
X velocity for projectile
Y velocity for projectile
member.returns: Spawned Projectile instance

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.StartFiring
member.summary: Initiates firing with rate control. Sets the fire counter based on fire rate: uses fireRate value for fast firing (rate < 0.3f) or 0 for slower rates.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.StartMelee
member.summary: Virtual method for initiating melee attacks. Empty implementation serves as an override point for subclasses to implement melee attack logic.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.StopFiring
member.summary: Virtual method placeholder for stopping fire action. Empty in base class, allows subclasses to implement fire stopping behavior.

member.summary: Picks up and prepares to throw a grenade. Disables the grenade, parents it to the player, handles achievement tracking for player-thrown grenades, plays throw sound, and initiates throwing animation.

member.summary: Picks up and prepares to throw a mook enemy. Sets the mook as being thrown, parents it to the player, plays heavy throw sound, and starts throwing animation with appropriate frame.

member.summary: Executes grenade throwing mechanics with specified position and velocity parameters.

X velocity for grenade trajectory
Y velocity for grenade trajectory
X position for grenade release

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.TriggerBroFireEvent
member.summary: Triggers perk system fire event for hero characters to activate fire-related perks and bonuses.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.TriggerBroMeleeEvent
member.summary: Triggers perk system melee event for hero characters to activate melee-related perks and bonuses.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.TriggerBroSpecialEvent
member.summary: Triggers perk system special ability event for hero characters to activate special-related perks and bonuses.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.UseFire
member.summary: Executes primary weapon firing sequence. Cancels melee if active, calculates projectile trajectory, spawns projectile, plays attack sound, and disturbs wildlife.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim._invulnerableTime
member.summary: Remaining duration of invulnerability in seconds. Decremented each frame, providing temporary damage immunity. Commonly set after spawning (3 seconds) or parachute destruction (1.33 seconds). Visual feedback provided through flashing effect.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.addedDeathMatchScore
member.summary: Flag preventing duplicate score additions in deathmatch game modes. Set to true after death score is recorded to ensure each death only counts once. Reset when the unit respawns for the next life.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.canDoIndependentMeleeAnimation
member.summary: Allows melee animations to play independently from movement animations. When true, melee attacks don't interrupt movement animations. Used by characters like IndianaBrones.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.canGib
member.summary: Determines if this character can be gibbed (exploded into pieces) when killed. Default true allows normal gibbing on death. Set to false for characters that should have death animations instead of exploding. Checked during death processing.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.cancelMeleeOnChangeDirection
member.summary: Stops melee attack when the character changes facing direction. Used by characters with directional melee attacks to ensure attacks match the intended direction.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.dashingMelee
member.summary: Indicates the character is performing a melee attack while dashing. Set by SetMeleeType() when dashing, triggers special dash-melee animations and damage values.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.deadTimeCounter
member.summary: Timer tracking how long the unit has been dead. Incremented each frame after death. Used for delayed effects like late gibbing, corpse removal, or preventing revival after extended death duration.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.disembowelHoldFrames
member.summary: Frame counter for chainsaw disembowelment death animation. When greater than zero, holds the death animation at the current frame to show prolonged chainsaw damage. Creates dramatic pause during brutal chainsaw deaths.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.doingMelee
member.summary: Indicates the character is currently performing a melee attack. Affects animation states and prevents certain other actions while active. Cleared when the melee attack completes.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.fireCounter
member.summary: Accumulates time to control automatic firing rate. When this counter exceeds fireRate, a shot is fired and the counter is decremented by fireRate. Initialized to 0.0667 to ensure immediate first shot capability.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.fireDelay
member.summary: Delay in seconds before firing can begin. Prevents immediate firing in certain situations such as after spawning or switching weapons.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.fireRate
member.summary: Time interval between automatic weapon shots in seconds. Default value of 0.0334 provides approximately 30 shots per second. Can be modified by power-ups through ValueOrchestrator.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.firedWhileInvulnerable
member.summary: Tracks if the player fired weapons during invulnerability period. When true, immediately cancels invulnerability as a penalty for aggressive play during spawn protection. Encourages defensive play after respawning.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.gibThreshold
member.summary: Health threshold below which the unit will gib instead of playing death animation (default -10). When health drops below this value from damage, the unit explodes into pieces. More negative values require more overkill damage to trigger gibbing.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.gibs
member.summary: Reference to the GibHolder containing gore particle prefabs for this character. Used when the unit is gibbed to spawn appropriate blood and body part effects. Each character can have unique gib sets for visual variety.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.hasPlayedMissSound
member.summary: Prevents multiple miss sound effects from playing for a single melee attack. Reset when canceling melee or starting a new attack.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.heroThatKilledMeIndex
member.summary: Player index of the hero that killed this unit (default -1 for no killer). Used for respawn positioning to place the unit near their killer. Also used for kill attribution in statistics and scoring systems.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.iDiedAtPosition
member.summary: World position where this unit died (default Vector3.zero). Stored for respawn calculations and death statistics. Used with heroThatKilledMeIndex to determine optimal respawn location near the action.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.impaledByChainSaw
member.summary: Flag indicating the unit was killed by chainsaw impalement. Currently not actively used in the codebase. May have been intended for special chainsaw death animations or to prevent certain post-death effects.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.impalementCollider
member.summary: GameObject reference to the collider used for impalement mechanics. Destroyed when cleanup is needed to prevent physics conflicts. Handles collision detection for impalement death scenarios.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.jumpingMelee
member.summary: Indicates the character is performing a melee attack while jumping or airborne. Set by SetMeleeType() based on action state, determines aerial melee animations and physics.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.lastAlertTime
member.summary: Tracks when the character last alerted nearby enemies. Prevents alert spam with minimum 0.07 seconds between alerts. Only alerts when character is alive and not in stealth mode.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.meleeChosenUnit
member.summary: Stores the target unit for melee attacks. Set when a valid melee target is found nearby and used to calculate movement toward the target during the melee animation.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.meleeFollowUp
member.summary: Indicates whether a melee combo or follow-up attack is allowed. Set to false in CancelMelee(), checked with dashingMelee to control combo behavior.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.meleeHasHit
member.summary: Tracks whether the current melee attack has successfully connected with a target. Prevents multiple damage applications from a single melee attack.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.projectileTime
member.summary: Cooldown timer preventing immediate detonation of remote projectiles after firing. Set to 0.3 seconds when firing remote explosives. Prevents accidental self-destruction by requiring a brief delay before detonation is allowed.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.remoteCar
member.summary: Reference to a remote control car currently being controlled by this character. When set, player input controls the car instead of the character. Provides reference for remote vehicle mechanics. Cleared when car is destroyed or control ends.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.remoteProjectile
member.summary: Reference to a projectile currently under remote control by this character. When set, character can detonate or guide the projectile. Cleared when projectile is destroyed or control is released. Used for remote-controlled explosives gameplay.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.skinnedMookOnMyBack
member.summary: Reference to a SkinnedMook enemy that has jumped onto this unit's back. When set, reduces movement speed by 50%, prevents dashing and wall climbing, and marks the unit as having "baggage". The attached enemy can be removed by melee attacks or death.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.specialCounter
member.summary: Controls timing for special ability usage. Similar to fireCounter but for special attacks. Initialized to 0.0667 seconds.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.standingMelee
member.summary: Indicates the character is performing a melee attack while standing or grounded. Set by SetMeleeType() based on action state, determines ground melee animations.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.willComeBackToLife
member.summary: Indicates this unit will resurrect after death. When true, displays a halo effect above the corpse and prevents certain death cleanup operations. The resurrection occurs after willComebackToLifeTime expires.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.willComebackToLifeTime
member.summary: Countdown timer in seconds until resurrection occurs. Set when unit dies with willComeBackToLife active. Decremented each frame while dead, triggering resurrection and full health restoration when reaching zero.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AddSpecialAmmo
member.summary: Increases special ammunition by 1 if below maximum capacity and updates the HeroController with the new value.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AirDashDown
member.summary: Initiates a downward slam air dash with an extended duration (5x normal), starting with a slight upward movement before transitioning to a powerful downward motion.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AirDashLeft
member.summary: Initiates a leftward air dash with a two-phase execution: a charge-up delay followed by the actual dash. The dash grants brief invulnerability and enables downward dashing afterwards.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AirDashRight
member.summary: Initiates a rightward air dash with a two-phase execution: a charge-up delay followed by the actual dash. The dash grants brief invulnerability and enables downward dashing afterwards.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AirDashUp
member.summary: Performs an instant upward air dash without charge-up delay, launching the character upward with 150% jump force for a shorter duration than horizontal dashes.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.Airdash(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Main air dash input handler that checks directional inputs and availability, then calls the appropriate directional dash method. Processes dashes in priority order: Right, Left, Down, Up.
member.param: If true, allows horizontal dashes without requiring fresh directional input.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.CanUseJetpack
member.summary: Checks if the hero can use jetpack abilities. Base implementation returns false, override for jetpack-enabled heroes.
member.returns: True if jetpack can be used

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.GetRemoteControlCar
member.summary: Creates and assigns a remote control car to this unit. Only executes for the owning player, sets up networking RPCs for control. Applies initial knockback and sets fire delay to prevent immediate use.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.GetSpecialAmmo
member.summary: Gets the current special ammunition count for this character.
member.returns: Current special ammunition amount

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.IsAmmoFull
member.summary: Checks if special ammunition is at maximum capacity compared to the original special ammo limit.
member.returns: True if ammunition is at maximum, false otherwise

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.MustUsePockettedSpecialAmmo
member.summary: Checks if pocketed special ammo must be used. Base implementation returns false, designed for override by characters with special ammo requirements.
member.returns: False in base implementation, can be overridden to return true when special ammo must be used

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.PickupPockettableAmmo(PockettedSpecialAmmoType)
member.summary: Handles picking up pocketable special ammunition. Virtual method intended for override by specific character implementations.
member.param: Type of pocketable ammo being picked up

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.PlayAidDashSound
member.summary: Virtual method for playing the air dash execution sound effect. Empty in base class, intended for override in derived classes. Note: Method name contains typo ("Aid" instead of "Air").

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.PlayAirDashChargeUpSound
member.summary: Virtual method for playing the air dash charge-up sound effect. Empty in base class, intended for override in derived classes.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.ResetSpecialAmmo
member.summary: Resets special ammunition to the original maximum amount and updates the HeroController with the new value.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunAirDashing
member.summary: Central air dash controller that manages dash execution based on direction. Delegates to specific directional dash methods, counts down dash timer, and clamps velocities to normal ranges when dash completes. Special handling for upward dashes limits velocity to 80% jump force.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunDownwardDash
member.summary: Executes downward slam dash with accelerating descent. Uses complex velocity calculation that accelerates downward movement, triggers sound and visual effects when reaching -50 velocity threshold, and clamps final velocity between 1.25x max fall speed and 300 units.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunLeftAirDash
member.summary: Executes leftward air dash with two-phase implementation. Delay phase: stops vertical movement and adds slight rightward anticipation movement. Dash phase: triggers animation change, plays dash sound, creates rightward poof effect, and calls SetAirDashLeftSpeed.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunRightAirDash
member.summary: Executes rightward air dash with two-phase implementation. Delay phase: stops vertical movement and adds slight leftward anticipation movement. Dash phase: triggers animation change, plays dash sound, creates leftward poof effect, and calls SetAirDashRightSpeed.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.RunUpwardDash
member.summary: Executes upward air dash immediately without delay phase. Resets jump timer, applies 150% jump force for strong upward boost, and zeroes horizontal movement.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetAirDashLeftSpeed
member.summary: Sets velocity for leftward air dash execution. Zeroes vertical movement and sets horizontal velocity to -2.3x normal speed for fast leftward movement.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetAirDashRightSpeed
member.summary: Sets velocity for rightward air dash execution. Zeroes vertical movement and sets horizontal velocity to 2.3x normal speed for fast rightward movement.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetAirdashAvailable
member.summary: Resets all directional air dash availability flags to true, allowing the character to perform air dashes in all directions again.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetHeldObjectPos(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Positions held objects (grenades/mooks) relative to character with specified offset coordinates.
member.param: X offset from character position
Y offset from character position

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetRemoteProjectile(Projectile)
member.summary: Associates a remote-controlled projectile with this unit. Updates projectile time tracking and stores the projectile reference.
member.param: The projectile to be remotely controlled

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.SetSpecialAmmoRPC(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets special ammunition amount via RPC for network synchronization and updates the HeroController.
member.param: Amount of special ammunition to set

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.StartPockettedSpecial
member.summary: Virtual method for initiating pocketed special ability. Empty in base class, designed for character-specific overrides to implement special weapon usage.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.UseJetpack
member.summary: Activates jetpack thrust for vertical movement. Virtual method intended for override by jetpack-equipped heroes.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.UsePockettedSpecial
member.summary: Virtual method for using pocketed special abilities. Resets facing direction and can be overridden by derived classes.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.UseSpecial
member.summary: Uses special ability (grenade throwing). Consumes special ammo, spawns grenade projectile with position-based trajectory, or flashes ammo indicator if depleted.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.UseSteroidsNetworked
member.summary: Activates steroid power-up effects across the network. Virtual method intended for override by heroes with steroid abilities.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.UseSteroidsNetworkedForDuration(System.Single)
member.summary: Activates steroid power-up effects for a specific duration across the network. Virtual method intended for override by heroes with timed steroid abilities.
member.param: Duration of the steroid effect in seconds

member.name: P:TestVanDammeAnim.SpecialAmmo
member.summary: Gets or sets the current special ammunition count. Setting this property synchronizes the value across all clients when the unit is owned by the local player.
member.value: The number of special ammunition units currently available.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim._specialAmmo
member.summary: Current special ammunition count (backing field for SpecialAmmo property). Changes to this value are synchronized across the network via RPC calls.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.originalSpecialAmmo
member.summary: Default and maximum special ammunition capacity. Typically set to 3 but can be overridden (e.g., 6 for certain game modes). Used to initialize special ammo on spawn and check if ammo is full.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.pressSpecialFacingDirection
member.summary: Stores the character's facing direction when a special ability is activated. Used to lock facing direction during special abilities when turnAroundWhhileUsingSpecials is false. Reset when actions complete.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.specialGrenade
member.summary: Reference to the grenade prefab spawned when using special abilities. Different throwing trajectories are used based on whether the character is ducking or standing.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.turnAroundWhhileUsingSpecials
member.summary: Controls whether the character can change facing direction while using special abilities. When false, the character's facing is locked to the direction they were facing when the special was activated. Defaults to true.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.usingPockettedSpecial
member.summary: Indicates the character is using a stored or pocketed special ability. Often set and cleared together with the main usingSpecial flag and affects animation states.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.usingSpecial
member.summary: Indicates the character is currently performing a special ability animation. Set true when special is pressed, false when animation completes or is interrupted by acid/remote control. Takes priority in animation selection.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.usingSpecial2
member.summary: Secondary special ability input state, primarily used by AI enemies. Checked as part of the IsUsingSpecial condition for determining if any special ability is active.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.usingSpecial3
member.summary: Tertiary special ability input state, primarily used by AI enemies. Part of the multi-special ability system that allows AI to have different special attacks.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.usingSpecial4
member.summary: Quaternary special ability input state, primarily used by AI enemies. Provides a fourth special ability option for complex AI behavior patterns.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.wasUsingSpecial
member.summary: Previous frame's primary special ability state. Used for edge detection to determine when special abilities are first activated.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.wasUsingSpecial2
member.summary: Previous frame's secondary special ability state. Used for edge detection of AI special ability inputs.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.wasUsingSpecial3
member.summary: Previous frame's tertiary special ability state. Used for edge detection of AI special ability inputs.

member.name: F:TestVanDammeAnim.wasUsingSpecial4
member.summary: Previous frame's quaternary special ability state. Used for edge detection to trigger AI special abilities on button press.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AddParentedDiff(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds positional differences to the character's coordinates based on parent movement, with special handling for different parent types.
member.param: The horizontal position difference to apply.
The vertical position difference to apply.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AddSpeedLeft
member.summary: Accelerates the character leftward with speed limits and multipliers based on movement state. Base acceleration is 2x, dashing provides 4x, and parachute reduces speed by 50%. Includes an extra 2.6x boost when below maximum speed.

member.name: M:TestVanDammeAnim.AddSpeedRight
